member.name: T:WizardWrx.AssemblyUtils.AssemblyContainer
member.summary: Use this class to hold a reference to an assembly that you want to confine to a separate AppDomain, so that the assembly can be unloaded by discarding its domain.

member.name: M:WizardWrx.AssemblyUtils.AssemblyContainer.#ctor
member.summary: The public constructor creates an empty container.

member.name: M:WizardWrx.AssemblyUtils.AssemblyContainer.Store(System.Reflection.AssemblyName)
member.summary: Call this method to load an assembly into the container.
member.param: Designate the assembly to load by its AssemblyName.

member.name: M:WizardWrx.AssemblyUtils.AssemblyContainer.ShowMe
member.summary: Get a transparent reference to the assembly stored in the container.
member.returns: The reference is returned through a transparent proxy, and the main AppDomain can treat it as if it were local. Hence, it can be used to instantiate objects, query their properties, and call their methods.

member.name: F:WizardWrx.AssemblyUtils.AssemblyContainer._pvtAsm
member.summary: The real assembly reference is hidden in this property, so that it isn't created simultaneously in both AppDomains.

member.name: T:WizardWrx.AssemblyUtils.DependentAssemblies
member.summary: Use instances of this class to enumerate the dependents of an assembly.

member.name: M:WizardWrx.AssemblyUtils.DependentAssemblies.#ctor
member.summary: Create an instance that has the calling assembly as its root.

member.name: M:WizardWrx.AssemblyUtils.DependentAssemblies.#ctor(System.Reflection.Assembly)
member.summary: Create an instance that has a specified assembly as its root.
member.param: Specify the assembly to establish as the top level reference assembly.

member.name: M:WizardWrx.AssemblyUtils.DependentAssemblies.AssemblyDependsUpon(System.Reflection.AssemblyName)
member.summary: Return TRUE if the root assembly of the instance depends upon the assembly named in its argument.
member.param: Specify the AssemblyName property, preferably fully qualified.
member.returns: If the assembly specified as the root when the instance was created depends upon the assembly named in the argument, the return value is TRUE. Otherwise, the return value is FALSE.

member.name: M:WizardWrx.AssemblyUtils.DependentAssemblies.DependentAssemblyIsLoaded(System.Reflection.AssemblyName)
member.summary: Return TRUE if the root assembly of the instance depends upon the assembly named in its argument AND that assembly is loaded.
member.param: Specify the AssemblyName property, preferably fully qualified.
member.returns: If the assembly specified as the root when the instance was created depends upon the assembly named in the argument, and the named assembly is loaded into the default Application Domain, the return value is TRUE. Otherwise, the return value is FALSE.

member.name: M:WizardWrx.AssemblyUtils.DependentAssemblies.DestroyDependents
member.summary: This object gets an explicitly implemented destructor, because it may acquire a secondary AppDomain that should be destroyed before the main processing routine progresses further.

member.name: M:WizardWrx.AssemblyUtils.DependentAssemblies.DisplayProperties(System.IO.StreamWriter,System.Char)
member.summary: List the properties of each dependent assembly.
member.param: Specify the optional output StreamWriter onto which the dependent assembly details are to be written. The default value is NULL, which suppresses output.
Specify the optional field delimiter. The default value is a comma.

member.name: M:WizardWrx.AssemblyUtils.DependentAssemblies.EnumerateDependents
member.summary: Enumerate the dependent assemblies.

member.name: M:WizardWrx.AssemblyUtils.DependentAssemblies.GetDependentAssemblyByName(System.Reflection.AssemblyName,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Get a reference to the named dependent assembly.
member.param: Specify the AssemblyName property, preferably fully qualified.
Set this flag to TRUE to permit an assembly to be loaded to satisfy the request. The default is FALSE, so that a request is unsatisfied unless the required assembly is already loaded.
member.returns: If the named assembly is a dependent, and it is successfully loaded, the return value is a reference to the assembly. If the assembly was already loaded into the default application domain, the reference is to that assembly. Otherwise, the reference is to the assembly that was loaded into the private application domain.

member.name: P:WizardWrx.AssemblyUtils.DependentAssemblies.Root
member.summary: Get the root assembly around which the instance was constructed.

member.name: T:WizardWrx.AssemblyUtils.DependentAssemblyInfo
member.summary: An instance of this class is created for each assembly listed as a dependent, and is used to track the assemblies that must be loaded to query their properties.

member.name: F:WizardWrx.AssemblyUtils.DependentAssemblyInfo.IS_LOADED
member.summary: The IsLoaded property has this value when the assembly is loaded when the DependentAssemblies query loop runs.

member.name: F:WizardWrx.AssemblyUtils.DependentAssemblyInfo.NOT_LOADED
member.summary: The IsLoaded property has this value when the assembly is unloaded when the DependentAssemblies query loop runs.

member.name: M:WizardWrx.AssemblyUtils.DependentAssemblyInfo.#ctor(System.Reflection.AssemblyName)
member.summary: The public constructor requires an AssemblyName from which to create an initialized instance.
member.param: AssemblyName fully describes an assembly, including properties that give direct access to the base (simple) name, version, culture, and public key token.

member.name: M:WizardWrx.AssemblyUtils.DependentAssemblyInfo.DestroyOwneAppdDomains
member.summary: You must call this method once, when you are finished using the object, but before it goes out of scope, to unload the private AppDomain, along with the assemblies that were loaded into it.
member.remarks: This activity cannot be performed by a destructor, because the unload fails with HRESULT 0x80131015 when the unload is initiated by a destructor, or when a destructor is active.

member.name: M:WizardWrx.AssemblyUtils.DependentAssemblyInfo.LoadForInspection
member.summary: The name of this method reflects its motivation, which was to report on the assemblies upon which a specified "root" assembly depends.

member.name: M:WizardWrx.AssemblyUtils.DependentAssemblyInfo.MarkAsLoaded(System.Reflection.Assembly)
member.summary: Call this method to mark an assembly as loaded.

member.name: M:WizardWrx.AssemblyUtils.DependentAssemblyInfo.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Test a pair of object instances for logical equality.
member.param: Supply a reference to the other object to test for equality with the calling instance.
member.returns: This method returns TRUE if the two objects are of the same or equivalent types and their FullName properties are equal. Otherwise, the return value is FALSE.

member.name: M:WizardWrx.AssemblyUtils.DependentAssemblyInfo.GetHashCode
member.summary: Return the HashCode property of the FullName property of the instance.

member.name: M:WizardWrx.AssemblyUtils.DependentAssemblyInfo.ToString
member.summary: Return a string representation of the instance.
member.returns: The returned string consists of the object type, as it would be reported by the base ToString method, followed by the FullName and IsLoaded property values.

member.name: P:WizardWrx.AssemblyUtils.DependentAssemblyInfo.AssemblyDetails
member.summary: Get the Assembly, itself. If it was already loaded for use, this is a reference to the live assembly. Otherwise, it is a copy that was loaded for reflection, and will be unloaded by the destructor.

member.name: P:WizardWrx.AssemblyUtils.DependentAssemblyInfo.FullName
member.summary: Get the FullName of the assembly.

member.name: P:WizardWrx.AssemblyUtils.DependentAssemblyInfo.IsLoaded
member.summary: Get the load state of the assembly.

member.name: T:WizardWrx.AssemblyUtils.PESubsystemInfo
member.summary: This class exposes methods for obtaining the subsystem ID encoded into the NT header of a Windows Portable Executable (PE) file. Such files include, but are not limited to, character mode and graphical mode programs implemented in both native or managed programming languages, dynamic link libraries, and device drivers.

member.name: T:WizardWrx.AssemblyUtils.PESubsystemInfo.PESubsystemID
member.summary: Map the unsigned integer returned by GetExeSubsystem onto an enumerated type that conveys its correct interpretation.

member.name: F:WizardWrx.AssemblyUtils.PESubsystemInfo.PESubsystemID.IMAGE_SUBSYSTEM_UNKNOWN
member.summary: Unknown subsystem.

member.name: F:WizardWrx.AssemblyUtils.PESubsystemInfo.PESubsystemID.IMAGE_SUBSYSTEM_NATIVE
member.summary: Image doesn't require a subsystem.

member.name: F:WizardWrx.AssemblyUtils.PESubsystemInfo.PESubsystemID.IMAGE_SUBSYSTEM_WINDOWS_GUI
member.summary: Image runs in the Windows GUI subsystem.

member.name: F:WizardWrx.AssemblyUtils.PESubsystemInfo.PESubsystemID.IMAGE_SUBSYSTEM_WINDOWS_CUI
member.summary: Image runs in the Windows character subsystem.

member.name: F:WizardWrx.AssemblyUtils.PESubsystemInfo.PESubsystemID.IMAGE_SUBSYSTEM_OS2_CUI
member.summary: Image runs in the OS/2 character subsystem.

member.name: F:WizardWrx.AssemblyUtils.PESubsystemInfo.PESubsystemID.IMAGE_SUBSYSTEM_POSIX_CUI
member.summary: Image runs in the Posix character subsystem.

member.name: F:WizardWrx.AssemblyUtils.PESubsystemInfo.PESubsystemID.IMAGE_SUBSYSTEM_NATIVE_WINDOWS
member.summary: Image is a native Win9x driver.

member.name: F:WizardWrx.AssemblyUtils.PESubsystemInfo.PESubsystemID.IMAGE_SUBSYSTEM_WINDOWS_CE_GUI
member.summary: Image runs in the Windows CE subsystem.

member.name: F:WizardWrx.AssemblyUtils.PESubsystemInfo.PESubsystemID.IMAGE_SUBSYSTEM_EFI_APPLICATION
member.summary: Image is an EFI Application.

member.name: F:WizardWrx.AssemblyUtils.PESubsystemInfo.PESubsystemID.IMAGE_SUBSYSTEM_EFI_BOOT_SERVICE_DRIVER
member.summary: Image is a EFI Boot Service Driver.

member.name: F:WizardWrx.AssemblyUtils.PESubsystemInfo.PESubsystemID.IMAGE_SUBSYSTEM_EFI_RUNTIME_DRIVER
member.summary: Image is a EFI Runtime Driver.

member.name: F:WizardWrx.AssemblyUtils.PESubsystemInfo.PESubsystemID.IMAGE_SUBSYSTEM_EFI_ROM
member.summary: Image runs from a EFI ROM.

member.name: F:WizardWrx.AssemblyUtils.PESubsystemInfo.PESubsystemID.IMAGE_SUBSYSTEM_XBOX
member.summary: Image runs on XBOX.

member.name: T:WizardWrx.AssemblyUtils.PESubsystemInfo.SubsystemDescription
member.summary: Each subsystem ID has both a short and long description. Use this enumeration as the second argument, penmSubsystemDescription, to static method GetPESubsystemDescription.

member.name: F:WizardWrx.AssemblyUtils.PESubsystemInfo.SubsystemDescription.Unspecified
member.summary: This value is invalid as input to GetPESubsystemDescription, and is defined to require the parameter to be explicitly set, so that there is no default value for penmSubsystemDescription.

member.name: F:WizardWrx.AssemblyUtils.PESubsystemInfo.SubsystemDescription.Short
member.summary: Return the short (one and two word) description.

member.name: F:WizardWrx.AssemblyUtils.PESubsystemInfo.SubsystemDescription.Long
member.summary: Return the long (complete sentence) description.

member.name: F:WizardWrx.AssemblyUtils.PESubsystemInfo.IMAGE_SUBSYSTEM_UNKNOWN
member.summary: The ProcessSubsystmID property returns this value until the private constructor initializes it.

member.name: F:WizardWrx.AssemblyUtils.PESubsystemInfo.IMAGE_SUBSYSTEM_WINDOWS_GUI
member.summary:
The ProcessSubsystmID property returns this value when queried on an PESubsystemInfo singleton instance that was initialized by a Windows (graphical mode) entry assembly.
Static method GetPESubsystemID returns this value when queried about the subsystem ID of a Windows (graphical mode) assembly or compiled native program.

member.name: F:WizardWrx.AssemblyUtils.PESubsystemInfo.IMAGE_SUBSYSTEM_WINDOWS_CUI
member.summary:
The ProcessSubsystmID property returns this value when queried on an PESubsystemInfo singleton instance that was initialized by a console (character mode) entry assembly.
Static method GetPESubsystemID returns this value when queried about the subsystem ID of a console (character mode) assembly or compiled native program.

member.name: F:WizardWrx.AssemblyUtils.PESubsystemInfo.s_astrShortNames
member.summary: This table maps the short description resource strings to the subsystem ID that they describe. Since subsystem IDs 4 and 6 are undefined, the corresponding elements are null references. If one is actually referenced, the resulting null reference exception must be caught, reported, and investigated.

members.member: This table maps the long description resource strings to the subsystem ID that they describe. Since subsystem IDs 4 and 6 are undefined, the corresponding elements are null references. If one is actually referenced, the resulting null reference exception must be caught, reported, and investigated.

member.name: P:WizardWrx.AssemblyUtils.PESubsystemInfo.DefaultAppDomainSubsystemID
member.summary: Get the subsystem ID of the default application domain.

member.name: P:WizardWrx.AssemblyUtils.PESubsystemInfo.DefaultAppDomainSubsystem
member.summary: Get the subsystem in which the default application domain executes.

member.name: P:WizardWrx.AssemblyUtils.PESubsystemInfo.DomainEntryAssemblyLocation
member.summary: Get the fully qualified name of the file from which the first assembly that was loaded into the default application domain was read.

member.name: P:WizardWrx.AssemblyUtils.PESubsystemInfo.DefaultDomainEntryAssemblyName
member.summary: Get the fully qualified AssemblyName of the first assembly that was loaded into the default application domain.
member.remarks: AssemblyName has properties that expose the parts of an assembly name, its simple name, version, culture, and public key token.

member.name: M:WizardWrx.AssemblyUtils.PESubsystemInfo.GetPESubsystemID(System.String)
member.summary: Call this method with the name of a file to get its subsystem ID.
member.param: This string must be the name of a file that can be found in the current security context. Names may be either relative or fully qualified. Relative file names are resolved relative to the current working directory.
member.returns: If the specified file exists and is a valid Windows Portable Executable (PE) file, its subsystem ID is returned. Since the ID is represented internally as a 16 bit signed integer, the return type of Int16 is guaranteed to be correct, regardless of the machine architecture. Debuggers and stack traces may represent this type as a short, a common alias for Int16.
member.exception:
The following conditions elicit an ArgumentException exception.
1) String argument pstrFileName is a null reference or points to the empty string.
2) String argument pstrFileName specifies a file that cannot be found in the current security context.
3) String argument pstrFileName specifies a file that is too small to contain a valid PE header, let alone its associated code and' data.

The following conditions elicit an Exception (the garden variety exception class) exception.
1) The file read returned, indicating that fewer than the expected number of bytes was read. This is probably the result of an internal programming error, and is unlikely to arise in practice, since this type of error should elicit an I/O exception.
2) The Int16 (16 bit signed integer) that marks the start of a valid DOS file header is missing.
3) The DWORD (32 bit unsigned integer) in the DOS header that should point to the start of the NT header is either null, or it points to a location beyond the first 1024 bytes of the file.
4) The magic Int32 (32 bit signed integer) that marks the start of the NT header is not where the pointer in the DOS header says it should be.
5) The I/O subsystem threw an exception. A new garden variety exception object is created, the I/O exception is attached as its InnerException property, and the new exception is thrown up the call stack.
Wrapping the I/O exception in a garden variety exception lets the final exception report include the name of the file that was being processed when the exception arose, which may provide useful clues about its root cause.
6) A completely unexpected event gave rise to an exception. A new garden variety exception object is created, the original exception is attached as its InnerException property, and the new exception is thrown up the call stack.
Wrapping the original I/O exception in a new exception lets the final exception report include the name of the file that was being processed when the exception arose, which may provide useful clues about its root cause.

member.name: M:WizardWrx.AssemblyUtils.PESubsystemInfo.GetPESubsystem(System.String)
member.summary: Use this wrapper to get the PESubsystemID enumeration member equivalent to the integer returned by GetPESubsystemID.
member.param: This string must be the name of a file that can be found in the current security context. Names may be either relative or fully qualified. Relative file names are resolved relative to the current working directory.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, its return value is a PESubsystemID member that corresponds to the 16-bit integer returned by GetPESubsystemID, which it calls internally.

member.name: M:WizardWrx.AssemblyUtils.PESubsystemInfo.GetPESubsystemDescription(System.Int16,WizardWrx.AssemblyUtils.PESubsystemInfo.SubsystemDescription)
member.summary: Get the short (one or two word) or long (complete, grammatically correct sentence) description that corresponds to a Portable Executable (PE) subsystem ID, such as the value returned by passing a file name to GetPESubsystemID.
member.param: Specify the subsystem ID for which the corresponding short or long description is wanted. Suitable inputs include the signed integer returned by GetPESubsystemID, which may be called as a nested method if you have no further use for the subsystem ID.
A member of the SubsystemDescription specifies whether to return the short (one or two word) description or the long (complete sentence) description that corresponds to the specified subsystem ID.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is a string containing a short or long description that corresponds to a specified subsystem ID.
member.exception: If the subsystem ID specified by argument pintSubsystemID is either negative or greater than the largest valid subsystem ID (9, at present, though future editions of the Microsoft Platform SDK might define additional IDs), an ArgumentOutOfRangeException exception is thrown, which reports the

An System.ComponentModel.InvalidEnumArgumentException exception is thrown when the second argument, penmSubsystemDescription, is either SubsystemDescription.Unspecified or is not a valid member of the SubsystemDescription enumeration. Unspecified is defined, but marked as invalid to ensure that if penmSubsystemDescription is a variable, it is initialized.

member.name: M:WizardWrx.AssemblyUtils.PESubsystemInfo.GetPESubsystemDescription(WizardWrx.AssemblyUtils.PESubsystemInfo.PESubsystemID,WizardWrx.AssemblyUtils.PESubsystemInfo.SubsystemDescription)
member.summary: Get the short (one or two word) or long (complete, grammatically correct sentence) description that corresponds to a Portable Executable (PE) subsystem ID, such as the value returned by passing a file name to GetPESubsystemID.
member.param: Specify the PESubsystemID enumeration value for which the corresponding string is needed. Suitable inputs include the value returned by GetPESubsystem or the DefaultDomainSubsystem property returned by the singleton instance.
A member of the SubsystemDescription specifies whether to return the short (one or two word) description or the long (complete sentence) description that corresponds to the specified subsystem ID.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is a string containing a short or long description that corresponds to a specified subsystem ID.
member.remarks: This method casts penmSubsystemID to Int16, and feeds it to GetPESubsystemDescription, since the cast wound be necessary, sooner or later, to use the lookup tables that contain the descriptions.

member.name: M:WizardWrx.AssemblyUtils.PESubsystemInfo.ToString
member.summary: Override the default ToString method to display the subsystem type.
member.returns:
The returned string resembles the following example.
{{Subsystem ID = Console (3)}} WizardWrx.AssemblyUtils.PESubsystemInfo

member.name: T:WizardWrx.AssemblyUtils.ReportGenerators
member.summary: The static members of this class generate reports about assemblies and their dependents.

member.name: M:WizardWrx.AssemblyUtils.ReportGenerators.GetAssemblyGuidString(System.Reflection.Assembly)
member.summary: Get the GUID string (Registry format) attached to an assembly.
member.param: Assembly from which to return the GUID string.
member.returns: If the method succeeds, the return value is the GUID attached to it and intended to be associated with its type library if the assembly is exposed to COM.

member.name: M:WizardWrx.AssemblyUtils.ReportGenerators.LabelKeyAssemblyProperties(System.IO.StreamWriter,System.Char)
member.param: Specify the open StreamWriter upon which to write.
Specify the delimiter character.
member.remarks: The label template is a managed resource string, REPORT_FIELD_NAMES, which governs the field order.

member.name: M:WizardWrx.AssemblyUtils.ReportGenerators.ListKeyAssemblyProperties(System.Reflection.Assembly,System.IO.StreamWriter,System.Char)
member.summary: Create a record and append it to the flat file behind a StreamWriter.
member.param: Specify the assembly to be evaluated.
Specify the open StreamWriter upon which to write.
Specify the delimiter character.
member.remarks: The label template is a managed resource string, REPORT_FIELD_NAMES, which governs the field order.

member.name: M:WizardWrx.AssemblyUtils.ReportGenerators.ShowKeyAssemblyProperties(System.Reflection.Assembly)
member.summary: List selected properties of any assembly on a console.
member.param: Pass in a reference to the desired assembly, which may be the assembly that exports a specified type, the executing assembly, the calling assembly, the entry assembly, or any other assembly for which you can obtain a reference.

member.name: T:WizardWrx.AssemblyUtils.SortableManagedResourceItem
member.summary: Instances of this class represent arbitrary managed resource items.
member.remarks: This class is necessary because the public dictionary is opaque, so a consumer has no control over the order in which they are returned. Since this wrapper implements the IComparable interface, collections of these objects can be sorted.

member.name: M:WizardWrx.AssemblyUtils.SortableManagedResourceItem.#ctor
member.summary: Other than satisfying the requirements of the IList interface, the uninitialized object is useless.

member.name: M:WizardWrx.AssemblyUtils.SortableManagedResourceItem.#ctor(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: This constructor creates a fully initialized instance from the data in the Current property of the IDictionaryEnumerator object returned by a ResourceSet instance.
member.param: Set the Name to the string returned by the Key property of the enumerator.
Set the Value to the System.object returned by the Value property of the enumerator.

member.name: P:WizardWrx.AssemblyUtils.SortableManagedResourceItem.Name
member.summary: The Name is the Name shown in the property sheet grid into which garden variety managed string resources are input.

member.name: P:WizardWrx.AssemblyUtils.SortableManagedResourceItem.Value
member.summary: The ResourceValue property is the Value property shown in the property sheet grid into which garden variety managed string resources are input, and its type is usually System.string.

member.name: P:WizardWrx.AssemblyUtils.SortableManagedResourceItem.TypeName
member.summary: Since the full type specification is accessible through the Value property, and the string representation of the FullName is its most useful property, it gets its own read only property, which also returns just "string" for the common case, for which the prefix is redundant.

member.name: M:WizardWrx.AssemblyUtils.SortableManagedResourceItem.System#IComparable{WizardWrx#AssemblyUtils#SortableManagedResourceItem}#CompareTo(WizardWrx.AssemblyUtils.SortableManagedResourceItem)
member.summary: Making the comparison based on the Name property permits sorting the resources in the most logical order.
member.param: The explicit implementation puts the burden of enforcing type safety on the runtime system.
member.returns: Since it is a pass-through of another CompareTo method, the return type is guaranteed to adhere to the interface specification.

member.name: M:WizardWrx.AssemblyUtils.SortableManagedResourceItem.GetInternalResourceName(System.String,System.Reflection.Assembly)
member.summary: Use the list of Manifest Resource Names returned by method GetManifestResourceNames on a specified assembly. Each of several methods employs a different mechanism to identify the assembly of interest.
member.param: Specify the name of the file from which the embedded resource was created. Typically, this will be the local name of the file in the source code tree.
Pass a reference to the Assembly that is supposed to contain the desired resource.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is the internal name of the requested resource, which is fed to GetManifestResourceStream on the same assembly, which returns a read-only Stream backed by the embedded resource. If the specified resource is not found, it returns null.
member.remarks: Since I cannot imagine any use for this method beyond its infrastructure role in this class, I marked it private.

member.name: M:WizardWrx.AssemblyUtils.SortableManagedResourceItem.ListResourcesInAssemblyByName(System.Reflection.Assembly)
member.summary: Call this static method from a console program to list the resources defined in an assembly alphabetically by name.
member.param: Specify the assembly that contains the resources to be enumerated.
member.remarks: This class creates and consumes a generic List of instances of the class that hosts it, and uses string padding to vertically align the list without resorting to composite format items.
